intro: Salix viminalis var. pallida, commonly known as white willow. This variety of willow is characterized by its pale, almost white bark, which distinguishes it from other Salix species. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to parts of Europe and Asia. The plant produces catkins and small, inconspicuous flowers, typical of the Salicaceae family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth margin, often turning yellow in the fall.
